dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in late last month, Israel's Ministry of Finance released some pretty stark numbers on Moderna's vaccine effectiveness.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in late last month, Israel's Ministry of Finance released some pretty stark numbers on Moderna's vaccine effectiveness.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israels Ministry of Health studied the roughly 1.7 million Israelis who had received both shots of Pfizers vaccine as of the end of last month, and released a report later obtained by Reuters and several local news outlets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they looked at about 200,000 people who'd gotten both doses, and the results were, uh, discouraging to say the least.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they looked at about two hundred thousand people who'd gotten both doses, and the results were, uh, discouraging to say the least.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israels Ministry of Health studied the roughly 1.7 million Israelis who had received both shots of Pfizers vaccine as of the end of last month, and released a report later obtained by Reuters and several local news outlets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right—the report said vaccinated Israelis were actually 45.8% more likely to get sick from Covid after two weeks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right-the report said vaccinated Israelis were actually forty five point eight percent more likely to get sick from Covid after two weeks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19 and 98.9% less likely to face hospitalization or death, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And almost 39% more likely to be hospitalized or die? That's… not what we were hoping for.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And almost thirty nine percent more likely to be hospitalized or die? That's... not what we were hoping for.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19 and 98.9% less likely to face hospitalization or death, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It gets worse—another study found the vaccine only reduced infection risk by 15%. That's shockingly low.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It gets worse-another study found the vaccine only reduced infection risk by fifteen percent. That's shockingly low.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This report follows a spate of good news from Israel: The countrys main healthcare provider said Sunday vaccinated patients are 92% less likely to end up with serious Covid-19 cases than their unvaccinated peers, and a non-peer reviewed study Thursday found just one dose of the vaccine reduces the risk of infection by 75% after two weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Israel's vaccination rate is just 5.4% fully vaccinated. They're dead last globally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Israel's vaccination rate is just five point four percent fully vaccinated. They're dead last globally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats the share of Israelis who are fully vaccinated as of Saturday, according to the New York Times tracker. The country ranks first in the world for vaccinations, compared to the United States 5.1% immunization rate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile the U.S. is at 32 percent. Israel's really struggling with distribution, partly 'cause of their HMO system and slow purchasing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile the U.S. is at thirty two percent. Israel's really struggling with distribution, partly 'cause of their H M O system and slow purchasing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israel is leading the worldwide vaccination race, partly due to the countrys small size, speed in buying up doses and comprehensive network of HMOs (the effort controversially doesnt include most residents of the West Bank and Gaza Strip).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Dr. Robert Redfield pointed out that Israel's a "small test case" for mass vaccination, and so far it's not looking good.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Dr. Robert Redfield pointed out that Israel's a small test case for mass vaccination, and so far it's not looking good.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israel has a remarkable diminution in cases associated with the efficiency of their vaccine, U.S. infectious disease expert Dr. Anthony Fauci said Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Cases and hospitalizations have been rising for weeks there. Really makes you wonder about those new variants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Cases and hospitalizations have been rising for weeks there. Really makes you wonder about those new variants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far, experts say theres reason for cautious optimism: cases and hospitalizations have declined for several weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Moderna and Pfizer say their vaccines might work better against the South Africa strain, but they're developing boosters anyway.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Moderna and Pfizer say their vaccines might work better against the South Africa strain, but they're developing boosters anyway.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most drugmakers including Pfizer, Moderna, Johnson & Johnson and Novavax say their vaccine candidates are somewhat less effective at staving off the virus variant rapidly spreading in South Africa, though they still offer patients some protection.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And despite all this, Israel's reopening everything next week—even for unvaccinated people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And despite all this, Israel's reopening everything next week-even for unvaccinated people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the coming weeks, residents who have received both Pfizer shots will get access to gyms, restaurants and bars, while those who cant prove vaccination or prior Covid-19 infection will need to stay away from nonessential places.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's wild. So if you're vaccinated, you have to stay away from essential places? That doesn't make sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's wild. So if you're vaccinated, you have to stay away from essential places? That doesn't make sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the coming weeks, residents who have received both Pfizer shots will get access to gyms, restaurants and bars, while those who cant prove vaccination or prior Covid-19 infection will need to stay away from nonessential places.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's the opposite of what most places are doing. Really unusual strategy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's the opposite of what most places are doing. Really unusual strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely a situation to keep an eye on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely a situation to keep an eye on.

artist_script:
HostA: Back in late last month, Israel's Ministry of Finance released some pretty stark numbers on Moderna's vaccine effectiveness.
HostB: Yeah, they looked at about 200,000 people who'd gotten both doses, and the results were, uh, discouraging to say the least.
HostA: Right—the report said vaccinated Israelis were actually 45.8% more likely to get sick from Covid after two weeks.
HostB: And almost 39% more likely to be hospitalized or die? That’s… not what we were hoping for.
HostA: It gets worse—another study found the vaccine only reduced infection risk by 15%. That’s shockingly low.
HostB: And Israel’s vaccination rate is just 5.4% fully vaccinated. They’re dead last globally.
HostA: Meanwhile the U.S. is at 32 percent. Israel’s really struggling with distribution, partly 'cause of their HMO system and slow purchasing.
HostB: Dr. Robert Redfield pointed out that Israel’s a "small test case" for mass vaccination, and so far it’s not looking good.
HostA: Cases and hospitalizations have been rising for weeks there. Really makes you wonder about those new variants.
HostB: Moderna and Pfizer say their vaccines might work better against the South Africa strain, but they’re developing boosters anyway.
HostA: And despite all this, Israel’s reopening everything next week—even for unvaccinated people.
HostB: That’s wild. So if you’re vaccinated, you have to stay away from essential places? That doesn’t make sense.
HostA: It’s the opposite of what most places are doing. Really unusual strategy.
HostB: Definitely a situation to keep an eye on.
